page.title: 07 Village School Centenary
page.content: It all began on April 15th 1878 when William Sargent opened the doors of Ilketshall St. Lawrence Board School. One hundred years later and the centenary celebrations began. The school celebrated this event on April 27th 1978 by having a special assembly and party. 50 special guests had been invited - ex headmasters, ex managers, Parish councillers and many old friends. Some planted trees, others exchanged fond memories, whilst most just enjoyed the happiness of the occasion. The present 78 children in the school had made classroom displays of pictures, poems, stories of old school days and photographs.The recorders learnt to play "Sweet Nightingale" which was the first recorded school song.
